segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is probably getting wet, but she doesn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is so unsteady, and he’s not even holding on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, like this is totally normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman would react if she saw them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so calm, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a cartoon where nothing bad ever happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But in real life, someone would get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall and crack his head open.
segments.speaker: PAR
